content: Open YouTube on your phone or tablet. If you pay for a subscription to YouTube Premium (formerly known as YouTube Red), you can easily download videos to watch offline. [1] Start by opening YouTube, which is the red square icon with a white triangle inside on the home screen (iPhone/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android). If you'd like to subscribe to YouTube Premium, tap your profile photo at the top-right corner of the YouTube app, select Get YouTube Premium , and then follow the on-screen instructions. [2] Tap the video you want to watch offline. The video will usually begin to play automatically. Tap the Download button. It’s a gray circle containing a down-arrow hovering over a white line, just beneath the video. Tap the desired video quality. The options may vary depending on the video. If you’d like the app to remember your selection for future downloads, check the box next to “Remember my settings.” Tap OK . This begins downloading the video at the selected size and quality. Once the video is downloaded, a blue and white check-mark will appear beneath it. [3] If you’re using an iPhone or iPad, the download will begin until you stop watching the version that’s currently streaming. [4] Navigate to your Library to watch a video when you're offline. Once you're disconnected from the internet, viewing the video is easy. Just tap the Library tab at the bottom-right corner of YouTube, and then tap the video. Navigate to a video that you want to watch offline. Click the name of any video at YouTube.com that you’d like to download. Copy the URL for the YouTube video. Highlight the entire URL, and then press Ctrl + C (PC) or ⌘ Command + C to copy it to the clipboard. Go to the Online Video Converter YouTube converter . This is a free website that converts YouTube videos to downloadable files. Right-click the “Paste link here” box. It’s at the top-center part of the page. A menu will expand. Click Paste . The copied URL now appears in the box. Select a video format from the “Format” menu. It’s right below the blank in which you pasted the URL. Select your desired video format from the “Video” menu on the right side of the list. Most modern video players support all of these formats. Click Start . It’s the orange button below the menu. A “Preparing your conversion” animation will appear. Once the conversion is complete, a “Download” link will appear. If you receive an error, it’s usually because you have a web browser plugin (such as an ad-blocker or other privacy-blocking tool) preventing the website from working. Disable any plugins that block parts of websites, reload the page, and then try again. Click Download . It’s a blue button near the top-center part of the page. This opens the “Save” dialog box on your computer. Click Save to download the video. The converted YouTube video will download to your computer. Once the download is complete, you can watch the video by double-clicking the file name. Download Documents by Readle from the App Store. This is a free app will allow you to easily download files (such as videos you’ve converted) and view them on your iPhone or iPad. Though you can access the converter site in the regular Safari app, you’ll want Documents to complete the download so you can easily find and view the video file. To download Documents: Open the App Store . Tap Search at the bottom-right corner. Type documents and tap Search. Scroll down and tap Documents by Readle (the app with a gray “D” with one multicolored corner). Tap GET . Follow the on-screen instructions to install the app. Once the install is complete, you can close the App Store. Open YouTube on your iPhone or iPad. It’s the white icon containing a red rectangle with a triangle inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen. Open the video you want to download to watch later. Tap a video’s name to open it now. It will usually start to play automatically. Tap Share . It’s the curved gray arrow below the video. Tap Copy link . It’s the round gray icon with two overlapping squares inside. This copies the URL to your clipboard. Open Documents. It’s the white icon with a gray D inside. It should be on one of your home screens. If it’s your first time using Documents, swipe through the introduction until it’s complete. Tap the blue compass icon. It’s at the bottom-right corner of Documents. This opens Documents’ built-in web browser. Navigate to /youtube-converter . Type or paste the URL into the blank at the top of the screen, and then tap the Go key to open the site. Tap and hold the “Paste link here” blank. Two options will appear. Tap Paste . This inserts the copied URL into the field. The video file will download by default as a .mp4 file, which will play without issues on your iPhone or iPad. If you want to change the format to something else, choose your desired format from the “Format” menu. Tap START . It’s the orange button. Online Video Converter will now convert the YouTube video to a downloadable file. Once it’s complete, you’ll be redirected to a download page. Tap DOWNLOAD . It’s the first blue button beneath the preview. This opens the “Save File” dialog. By default, the file will save to the Downloads folder in the Documents app. Don’t change this location—this is how you’ll be able to watch the video without running into restrictions. Tap Done . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. The file will now download to your iPhone or iPad. Once the download is complete, a red number will appear on the Downloads icon (the down-arrow with a line at the bottom of the screen). You may be prompted to enable notifications for the app at this point. Tap Allow if you want to receive notifications when downloads are complete (as well as other events in Documents), or Don’t Allow if you don’t want notifications at all. Tap the Downloads icon. It’s the down-arrow with a red number at the bottom of the screen. A list of files you’ve downloaded with Documents will appear, including the video you just downloaded. Tap the video when you want to watch it. It will open in your iPhone or iPad’s default video player. To watch the video later, open Documents , tap the Downloads folder, and then tap the video file. Open YouTube on your Android. It’s the red rectangle with a white sideways triangle inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer. Open the video you want to download to watch later. Tap a video’s name to open it now. It will usually start to play automatically. Tap Share . It’s the curved gray arrow below the video. Tap Copy link . It’s the round gray icon with two overlapping squares inside. This copies the URL to your clipboard. Open a web browser. You can use Chrome, Samsung Internet, or any other browser you prefer. . Navigate to /youtube-converter . Type or paste the URL into the blank at the top of the screen, and then tap the Enter key to open the site. Tap and hold the “Paste link here” blank. Some options will appear. Tap Paste . This inserts the copied URL into the field. The video file will download by default as a .mp4 file, which will play without issues on your Android. If you want to change the format to something else, choose your desired format from the “Format” menu. Tap START . It’s the orange button. Online Video Converter will now convert the YouTube video to a downloadable file. Once it’s complete, you’ll be redirected to a download page. If any ads or notification requests pop up, dismiss them to continue. Tap DOWNLOAD . It’s the first blue button beneath the preview. Follow the on-screen instructions to save the file. The remaining steps will vary depending on your Android, but you’ll often see a “Download file” window that gives you the option to choose a download location. Select your Downloads folder if not already selected, and then follow the on-screen instructions to save the file. You may have to give the app permission to save files to the device before the “Download file” window appears. Watch the video when you’re offline. When it’s time to watch the video, open the Downloads app on your Android—you’ll usually find it in the app drawer—and then tap the video to open it. If you don’t have an app called Downloads , open your file manager app (often called My Files , Files , or File Manager ), and then browse to the Downloads folder.

<p>This wikiHow teaches you how to download a YouTube video to watch offline on a computer, phone, or tablet. If you’re a paid subscriber to YouTube Premium, you can easily download videos for offline viewing in the YouTube app. If not, you’ll need to use a converter like OnlineVideoConverter to turn the stream into a downloadable file.</p>

<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-1-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-1-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">

</div>

<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Open YouTube on your phone or tablet.</b> If you pay for a subscription to YouTube Premium (formerly known as YouTube Red), you can easily download videos to watch offline.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> Start by opening YouTube, which is the red square icon with a white triangle inside on the home screen (iPhone/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android).

<ul>
<li>If you'd like to subscribe to YouTube Premium, tap your profile photo at the top-right corner of the YouTube app, select <b>Get YouTube Premium</b>, and then follow the on-screen instructions.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-2-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-2-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Watch YouTube Offline Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid4596662-v4-728px-Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_35951a818c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_35951a818c')</script>

<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-3-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-3-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">

<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>

<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Tap the desired video quality.</b> The options may vary depending on the video.

</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Watch YouTube Offline Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid4596662-v4-728px-Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-5-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Tap <span style="white-space: nowrap;"><span class="nowrap" style="font-family:Lucida Sans Unicode,Lucida Grande,sans-serif;font-size:14px;padding:0em 1em; border:1px solid; border-color:#AAA #555 #555 #AAA; -moz-border-radius: 4px; -webkit-border-radius: 4px; border-radius: 4px; background-color: #F2F2F2; background-image: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -o-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0);" title="This is not a clickable button; it illustrates the button one should find.">OK</span></span>.</b> This begins downloading the video at the selected size and quality. Once the video is downloaded, a blue and white check-mark will appear beneath it.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you’re using an iPhone or iPad, the download will begin until you stop watching the version that’s currently streaming.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</li>

</div>

</div>

<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Navigate to your Library to watch a video when you're offline.</b> Once you're disconnected from the internet, viewing the video is easy. Just tap the <b>Library</b> tab at the bottom-right corner of YouTube, and then tap the video.

</div>

</li>

</div>

<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-9-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-9-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">

<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">

<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Right-click the “Paste link here” box.</b> It’s at the top-center part of the page. A menu will expand.

<b class="whb">Click <span style="white-space: nowrap;"><span class="nowrap" style="font-family:Lucida Sans Unicode,Lucida Grande,sans-serif;font-size:14px;padding:0em 1em; border:1px solid; border-color:#AAA #555 #555 #AAA; -moz-border-radius: 4px; -webkit-border-radius: 4px; border-radius: 4px; background-color: #F2F2F2; background-image: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -o-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0);" title="This is not a clickable button; it illustrates the button one should find.">Paste</span></span>.</b> The copied URL now appears in the box.

<li class="hasimage">

<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Select a video format from the “Format” menu.</b> It’s right below the blank in which you pasted the URL. Select your desired video format from the “Video” menu on the right side of the list. Most modern video players support all of these formats.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-13-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-13-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">

</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Watch YouTube Offline Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-13-Version-4.jpg/aid4596662-v4-728px-Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-13-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Click <span style="white-space: nowrap;"><span class="nowrap" style="font-family:Lucida Sans Unicode,Lucida Grande,sans-serif;font-size:14px;padding:0em 1em; border:1px solid; border-color:#AAA #555 #555 #AAA; -moz-border-radius: 4px; -webkit-border-radius: 4px; border-radius: 4px; background-color: #F2F2F2; background-image: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -o-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0); background-image: linear-gradient(top, #FCFCFC, #E0E0E0);" title="This is not a clickable button; it illustrates the button one should find.">Start</span></span>.</b> It’s the orange button below the menu. A “Preparing your conversion” animation will appear. Once the conversion is complete, a “Download” link will appear.

<ul>
<li>If you receive an error, it’s usually because you have a web browser plugin (such as an ad-blocker or other privacy-blocking tool) preventing the website from working. Disable any plugins that block parts of websites, reload the page, and then try again.</li>
</ul>

<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>

<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Watch YouTube Offline Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid4596662-v4-728px-Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_b720eecd3e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b720eecd3e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Watch YouTube Offline Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid4596662-v4-728px-Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>

defer.add(img);

</div>
.</li>
<li>Tap <b>Search</b> at the bottom-right corner.</li>
<li>Type <kbd style="background:#EEEEEE; letter-spacing:0.1em; padding-left:0.5em; padding-right:0.4em;">documents</kbd> and tap Search.</li>
<li>Scroll down and tap <b>Documents by Readle</b> (the app with a gray “D” with one multicolored corner).</li>
<li>Tap <b>GET</b>.</li>
<li>Follow the on-screen instructions to install the app. Once the install is complete, you can close the App Store.</li>

<div aria-label="Step 11" class="step_num">11</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_11"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Follow the on-screen instructions to save the file.</b> The remaining steps will vary depending on your Android, but you’ll often see a “Download file” window that gives you the option to choose a download location. Select your Downloads folder if not already selected, and then follow the on-screen instructions to save the file.

<ul>
<li>You may have to give the app permission to save files to the device before the “Download file” window appears.</li>
</ul>

<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-42.jpg?ajax=true&aid=4596662" href="#/Image:Watch-YouTube-Offline-Step-42.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">

<div aria-label="Step 12" class="step_num">12</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_12"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Watch the video when you’re offline.</b> When it’s time to watch the video, open the <b>Downloads</b> app on your Android—you’ll usually find it in the app drawer—and then tap the video to open it.

<ul>
<li>If you don’t have an app called <b>Downloads</b>, open your file manager app (often called <b>My Files</b>, <b>Files</b>, or <b>File Manager</b>), and then browse to the <b>Downloads</b> folder.</li>
</ul>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
/* global mw, WH, MachinifyAPI*/
document.addEventListener( 'DOMContentLoaded', function () {
	var banner = document.getElementById( 'campaign-adBanner' );
	var widget = document.getElementById( 'campaign-desktopWidget' );
	if ( mw.user.isAnon() && !window._ads || ( banner && widget && banner.offsetHeight == 0 ) ) {
		var root = '/extensions/wikihow/Honeypot/campaigns/support/';
		var sources = [
			{ ref: 'small', srcset: [ root + 'small@1x.png 300w', root + 'small@2x.png 600w', root + 'small@3x.png 900w' ] },
			{ ref: 'large', srcset: [ root + 'large@1x.png 300w', root + 'large@2x.png 600w', root + 'large@3x.png 900w' ] },
		];
		var index = Math.floor( Math.random() * sources.length );
		var ref = sources[index].ref;
		var link = document.getElementById( 'campaign-link' );
		var image = document.getElementById( 'campaign-image' );
		var target = '/wikiHow:Contribute';
		// Pass extra data to the campaign special page
		if ( target.indexOf( '/Special:Campaign/' ) == 0 ) {
			target += '?ref=' + encodeURIComponent( ref ) +
				'&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( location.pathname );
		}
		widget.style.display = 'block';
		image.setAttribute( 'srcset', sources[index].srcset.join() );
		link.setAttribute( 'href', target ); 
		link.onclick = function ( e ) {
			e.preventDefault();
			// Track click
			WH.maEvent(
				'support_ad_click',
				{ origin: location.hostname, ref: ref },
				function () {
					window.location = link.getAttribute( 'href' );
				}
			);
		};
		image.onload = function () {
			// Track view
			var done = false;
			var interval = setInterval( function () {
				if ( !done && MachinifyAPI ) {
					done = true;
					WH.maEvent( 'support_ad_view', { origin: location.hostname, ref: ref } );
					clearInterval( interval );
				}
			}, 100 );
		};
	}
} );

</script>

            "name": "Using YouTube Premium for Android, iPhone, or iPad",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Open YouTube on your phone or tablet. If you pay for a subscription to YouTube Premium (formerly known as YouTube Red), you can easily download videos to watch offline.[1] Start by opening YouTube, which is the red square icon with a white triangle inside on the home screen (iPhone\/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android).\n\nIf you'd like to subscribe to YouTube Premium, tap your profile photo at the top-right corner of the YouTube app, select Get YouTube Premium, and then follow the on-screen instructions.[2]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the video you want to watch offline. The video will usually begin to play automatically."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the Download button. It\u2019s a gray circle containing a down-arrow hovering over a white line, just beneath the video."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the desired video quality. The options may vary depending on the video.\n\nIf you\u2019d like the app to remember your selection for future downloads, check the box next to \u201cRemember my settings.\u201d"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap OK. This begins downloading the video at the selected size and quality. Once the video is downloaded, a blue and white check-mark will appear beneath it.[3]\nIf you\u2019re using an iPhone or iPad, the download will begin until you stop watching the version that\u2019s currently streaming.[4]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Navigate to your Library to watch a video when you're offline. Once you're disconnected from the internet, viewing the video is easy. Just tap the Library tab at the bottom-right corner of YouTube, and then tap the video."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Using OnlineVideoConverter on a Computer",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Navigate to a video that you want to watch offline. Click the name of any video at YouTube.com that you\u2019d like to download."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Copy the URL for the YouTube video. Highlight the entire URL, and then press Ctrl+C (PC) or \u2318 Command+C to copy it to the clipboard."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Go to the Online Video Converter YouTube converter. This is a free website that converts YouTube videos to downloadable files."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Right-click the \u201cPaste link here\u201d box. It\u2019s at the top-center part of the page. A menu will expand."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Click Paste. The copied URL now appears in the box."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Select a video format from the \u201cFormat\u201d menu. It\u2019s right below the blank in which you pasted the URL. Select your desired video format from the \u201cVideo\u201d menu on the right side of the list. Most modern video players support all of these formats."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Click Start. It\u2019s the orange button below the menu. A \u201cPreparing your conversion\u201d animation will appear. Once the conversion is complete, a \u201cDownload\u201d link will appear.\n\nIf you receive an error, it\u2019s usually because you have a web browser plugin (such as an ad-blocker or other privacy-blocking tool) preventing the website from working. Disable any plugins that block parts of websites, reload the page, and then try again."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Click Download. It\u2019s a blue button near the top-center part of the page. This opens the \u201cSave\u201d dialog box on your computer."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Click Save to download the video. The converted YouTube video will download to your computer. Once the download is complete, you can watch the video by double-clicking the file name."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Using OnlineVideoConverter on an iPhone or iPad",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Download Documents by Readle from the App Store. This is a free app will allow you to easily download files (such as videos you\u2019ve converted) and view them on your iPhone or iPad. Though you can access the converter site in the regular Safari app, you\u2019ll want Documents to complete the download so you can easily find and view the video file. To download Documents:\n\nOpen the App Store\n\n.\nTap Search at the bottom-right corner.\nType documents and tap Search.\nScroll down and tap Documents by Readle (the app with a gray \u201cD\u201d with one multicolored corner).\nTap GET.\nFollow the on-screen instructions to install the app. Once the install is complete, you can close the App Store."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Open YouTube on your iPhone or iPad. It\u2019s the white icon containing a red rectangle with a triangle inside. You\u2019ll usually find it on the home screen."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Open the video you want to download to watch later. Tap a video\u2019s name to open it now. It will usually start to play automatically."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap Share. It\u2019s the curved gray arrow below the video."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap Copy link. It\u2019s the round gray icon with two overlapping squares inside. This copies the URL to your clipboard."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Open Documents. It\u2019s the white icon with a gray D inside. It should be on one of your home screens.\n\nIf it\u2019s your first time using Documents, swipe through the introduction until it\u2019s complete."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the blue compass icon. It\u2019s at the bottom-right corner of Documents. This opens Documents\u2019 built-in web browser."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Navigate to https:\/\/www.onlinevideoconverter.com\/youtube-converter. Type or paste the URL into the blank at the top of the screen, and then tap the Go key to open the site."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap and hold the \u201cPaste link here\u201d blank. Two options will appear."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 10,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap Paste. This inserts the copied URL into the field.\n\nThe video file will download by default as a .mp4 file, which will play without issues on your iPhone or iPad. If you want to change the format to something else, choose your desired format from the \u201cFormat\u201d menu."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 11,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap START. It\u2019s the orange button. Online Video Converter will now convert the YouTube video to a downloadable file. Once it\u2019s complete, you\u2019ll be redirected to a download page."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 12,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap DOWNLOAD. It\u2019s the first blue button beneath the preview. This opens the \u201cSave File\u201d dialog.\n\nBy default, the file will save to the Downloads folder in the Documents app. Don\u2019t change this location\u2014this is how you\u2019ll be able to watch the video without running into restrictions."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 13,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap Done. It\u2019s at the top-right corner of the screen. The file will now download to your iPhone or iPad.\n\nOnce the download is complete, a red number will appear on the Downloads icon (the down-arrow with a line at the bottom of the screen).\nYou may be prompted to enable notifications for the app at this point. Tap Allow if you want to receive notifications when downloads are complete (as well as other events in Documents), or Don\u2019t Allow if you don\u2019t want notifications at all."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 14,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the Downloads icon. It\u2019s the down-arrow with a red number at the bottom of the screen. A list of files you\u2019ve downloaded with Documents will appear, including the video you just downloaded."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 15,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Tap the video when you want to watch it. It will open in your iPhone or iPad\u2019s default video player.\n\nTo watch the video later, open Documents, tap the Downloads folder, and then tap the video file."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },

title: How to Watch YouTube Offline
content_html:
Open YouTube on your phone or tablet. If you pay for a subscription to YouTube Premium (formerly known as YouTube Red), you can easily download videos to watch offline.[1] Start by opening YouTube, which is the red square icon with a white triangle inside on the home screen (iPhone/iPad) or in the app drawer (Android).
  • If you'd like to subscribe to YouTube Premium, tap your profile photo at the top-right corner of the YouTube app, select Get YouTube Premium, and then follow the on-screen instructions.[2]
Tap the video you want to watch offline. The video will usually begin to play automatically.
Tap the Download button. It’s a gray circle containing a down-arrow hovering over a white line, just beneath the video.
Tap the desired video quality. The options may vary depending on the video.
  • If you’d like the app to remember your selection for future downloads, check the box next to “Remember my settings.”
Tap OK. This begins downloading the video at the selected size and quality. Once the video is downloaded, a blue and white check-mark will appear beneath it.[3]
  • If you’re using an iPhone or iPad, the download will begin until you stop watching the version that’s currently streaming.[4]
Navigate to your Library to watch a video when you're offline. Once you're disconnected from the internet, viewing the video is easy. Just tap the Library tab at the bottom-right corner of YouTube, and then tap the video.
Navigate to a video that you want to watch offline. Click the name of any video at YouTube.com that you’d like to download.
Copy the URL for the YouTube video. Highlight the entire URL, and then press Ctrl+C (PC) or ⌘ Command+C to copy it to the clipboard.
Go to the Online Video Converter YouTube converter. This is a free website that converts YouTube videos to downloadable files.
Right-click the “Paste link here” box. It’s at the top-center part of the page. A menu will expand.
Click Paste. The copied URL now appears in the box.
Select a video format from the “Format” menu. It’s right below the blank in which you pasted the URL. Select your desired video format from the “Video” menu on the right side of the list. Most modern video players support all of these formats.
Click Start. It’s the orange button below the menu. A “Preparing your conversion” animation will appear. Once the conversion is complete, a “Download” link will appear.
  • If you receive an error, it’s usually because you have a web browser plugin (such as an ad-blocker or other privacy-blocking tool) preventing the website from working. Disable any plugins that block parts of websites, reload the page, and then try again.
Click Download. It’s a blue button near the top-center part of the page. This opens the “Save” dialog box on your computer.
Click Save to download the video. The converted YouTube video will download to your computer. Once the download is complete, you can watch the video by double-clicking the file name.
Download Documents by Readle from the App Store. This is a free app will allow you to easily download files (such as videos you’ve converted) and view them on your iPhone or iPad. Though you can access the converter site in the regular Safari app, you’ll want Documents to complete the download so you can easily find and view the video file. To download Documents:
  • Open the App Store
    .
  • Tap Search at the bottom-right corner.
  • Type documents and tap Search.
  • Scroll down and tap Documents by Readle (the app with a gray “D” with one multicolored corner).
  • Tap GET.
  • Follow the on-screen instructions to install the app. Once the install is complete, you can close the App Store.
Open YouTube on your iPhone or iPad. It’s the white icon containing a red rectangle with a triangle inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen.
Open the video you want to download to watch later. Tap a video’s name to open it now. It will usually start to play automatically.
Tap Share. It’s the curved gray arrow below the video.
Tap Copy link. It’s the round gray icon with two overlapping squares inside. This copies the URL to your clipboard.
Open Documents. It’s the white icon with a gray D inside. It should be on one of your home screens.
  • If it’s your first time using Documents, swipe through the introduction until it’s complete.
Tap the blue compass icon. It’s at the bottom-right corner of Documents. This opens Documents’ built-in web browser.
Navigate to https://www.onlinevideoconverter.com/youtube-converter. Type or paste the URL into the blank at the top of the screen, and then tap the Go key to open the site.
Tap and hold the “Paste link here” blank. Two options will appear.
Tap Paste. This inserts the copied URL into the field.
  • The video file will download by default as a .mp4 file, which will play without issues on your iPhone or iPad. If you want to change the format to something else, choose your desired format from the “Format” menu.
Tap START. It’s the orange button. Online Video Converter will now convert the YouTube video to a downloadable file. Once it’s complete, you’ll be redirected to a download page.
Tap DOWNLOAD. It’s the first blue button beneath the preview. This opens the “Save File” dialog.
  • By default, the file will save to the Downloads folder in the Documents app. Don’t change this location—this is how you’ll be able to watch the video without running into restrictions.
Tap Done. It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. The file will now download to your iPhone or iPad.
  • Once the download is complete, a red number will appear on the Downloads icon (the down-arrow with a line at the bottom of the screen).
  • You may be prompted to enable notifications for the app at this point. Tap Allow if you want to receive notifications when downloads are complete (as well as other events in Documents), or Don’t Allow if you don’t want notifications at all.
Tap the Downloads icon. It’s the down-arrow with a red number at the bottom of the screen. A list of files you’ve downloaded with Documents will appear, including the video you just downloaded.
Tap the video when you want to watch it. It will open in your iPhone or iPad’s default video player.
  • To watch the video later, open Documents, tap the Downloads folder, and then tap the video file.
Open YouTube on your Android. It’s the red rectangle with a white sideways triangle inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer.
Open the video you want to download to watch later. Tap a video’s name to open it now. It will usually start to play automatically.
Tap Share. It’s the curved gray arrow below the video.
Tap Copy link. It’s the round gray icon with two overlapping squares inside. This copies the URL to your clipboard.
Open a web browser. You can use Chrome, Samsung Internet, or any other browser you prefer. .
Navigate to https://www.onlinevideoconverter.com/youtube-converter. Type or paste the URL into the blank at the top of the screen, and then tap the Enter key to open the site.
Tap and hold the “Paste link here” blank. Some options will appear.
Tap Paste. This inserts the copied URL into the field.
  • The video file will download by default as a .mp4 file, which will play without issues on your Android. If you want to change the format to something else, choose your desired format from the “Format” menu.
Tap START. It’s the orange button. Online Video Converter will now convert the YouTube video to a downloadable file. Once it’s complete, you’ll be redirected to a download page.
  • If any ads or notification requests pop up, dismiss them to continue.
Tap DOWNLOAD. It’s the first blue button beneath the preview.
Follow the on-screen instructions to save the file. The remaining steps will vary depending on your Android, but you’ll often see a “Download file” window that gives you the option to choose a download location. Select your Downloads folder if not already selected, and then follow the on-screen instructions to save the file.
  • You may have to give the app permission to save files to the device before the “Download file” window appears.
Watch the video when you’re offline. When it’s time to watch the video, open the Downloads app on your Android—you’ll usually find it in the app drawer—and then tap the video to open it.
  • If you don’t have an app called Downloads, open your file manager app (often called My Files, Files, or File Manager), and then browse to the Downloads folder.
